alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:38PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties near the Village of Oak Creek through 215 PM MST... At 137 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Village At Oak Creek, or near Sedona. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedona and Village At Oak Creek. This includes the following highways... State Route 179 between mile markers 302 and 311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
